source.text: Automorphisms: isomorphisms G≅G form a group under composition (Smith §2.5 and standard algebra).

statements: Aut(G) forms a group under composition with identity id_G and inverses f^{-1}.
For finite G, Aut(G) can be enumerated by bijections that respect the operation.
unlocks: Action of G on itself by conjugation: G → Aut(G).
Class equation, centers, and G/Z(G) ≅ Inn(G) (future).
